node.title: Judge Rejects Trump’s Bid to Keep Papers Secret in Jan. 6 Inquiry
node.description: But a Trump lawyer has signaled an intent to appeal the ruling, which raises novel issues about an ex-president’s executive privilege powers.

node.title: COP26: Obama chides China and Russia, urges support for poorer nations
node.description: Former US President Barack Obama has called for rich nations to end years of deadlock with developing countries over cash for climate change, and criticised China and Russia.

node.title: Obama addresses High Ambition Coalition countries at COP26
node.description: Explainer - New Zealand is part of a coalition pushing for more progressive climate policies in Glasgow.

node.title: Green Bay Packers, Aaron Rodgers and Allen Lazard fined for COVID violations
node.description: Aaron Rodgers tested positive for COVID-19 last week, and later revealed he was not vaccinated.

node.title: Emotion and Grit Power Kenyans in New York City Marathon
node.description: Albert Korir won the men’s division in 2:08:22, while Peres Jepchirchir won the women’s division in 2:22:39 after also winning at the Tokyo Games.

node.title: Tuvalu minister gives COP26 speech standing knee-deep in the sea
node.description: Simon Kofe wears a suit and tie at a lectern set up in the sea, speaking from what used to be dry land to draw attention to Tuvalu's struggle against rising sea levels.

node.title: Tyson Fury '50 per cent fit' for fight with Deontay Wilder
node.description: Tyson Fury was dealing with a serious injury during his heavyweight championship fight with Deontay Wilder and has since required surgery, his father John says.

node.title: Paramedic's bid to be exempt from 'morally repugnant' vax mandate struck down in court
node.description: Veteran health worker and Snowy Valleys Deputy Mayor John Larter's legal push to have part of the state's public health orders declared invalid is rejected in the Supreme Court.

node.title: Farmers need support to adjust to increase in dry conditions, reports say
node.description: Regional councils and primary sector bodies are being told they need to act now to better support farmers to grow food under increasingly dry conditions.

node.title: BNZ annual net profit rises by 74% to $1.3bn
node.description: Another major retail bank has seen its profits surge, driven by the strong economic rebound from Covid-19, high demand for mortgages and a lack of bad debts.

node.title: Fonterra continues plans to vote on future of capital structure
node.description: Dairy giant Fonterra is pressing on with plans to hold a vote on the future of its capital structure, despite not yet having government support for the proposal.

node.title: Air NZ preparing for summer holiday flights ahead of govt border restriction announcement
node.description: Air New Zealand's chief executive estimates it could take up to six weeks to prepare to fly New Zealanders to their chosen Christmas destinations, so it needs a decision on borders urgently. Audio

node.title: Central Otago orchards concerned they won't have enough staff this season
node.description: Some Central Otago orchards are scrambling to find enough staff with less than a month until harvest.

node.title: Tower Insurance changes flood risk pricing, reduces part of premium
node.description: Nearly 90 percent of Tower customers will have the flood risk portion of their premium reduced, at an average of $25 each.

node.title: Average residential home now worth more than $1m
node.description: The property market reached new heights last month with the average residential home value topping a million dollars for the first time. The property market reached new heights last month...

node.title: Pistorius could be up for parole
node.description: The South African Paralympic athlete Oscar Pistorius, convicted of murdering his girlfriend Reeva Steenkamp, may soon meet her parents as part of the process leading up to parole.

node.title: Lowe keen to play against All Blacks
node.description: Ireland wing James Lowe is relishing the prospect of playing against some of his closest friends in this weekend's game against his native New Zealand.

node.title: 'We're going to give it everything' - Moana Pasifika's road to Super Rugby
node.description: After 26 years of waiting, what's another couple of months?

node.title: Aaron Smith back with All Blacks
node.description: All Blacks halfback Aaron Smith will join the squad in Dublin midweek to provide injury cover.

node.title: England deny they're favourites for World Cup semi-final
node.description: England captain Eoin Morgan won't say who'll move up to partner opener Jos Buttler and dismissed suggestions his side would be "strong favourites" against New Zealand.

node.title: Ardern's Auckland visit: 'I'll be able to talk to the workforce'
node.description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern will meet with workers, businesspeople and frontline health workers on her visit to Auckland tomorrow, but is not expected to be out and about in public.

node.title: Protests represent a small minority, politicians say
node.description: Politicians of all stripes say the protests at Parliament today represent just a small minority of New Zealanders, as first-dose vaccination rates near the 90 percent mark.

node.title: Watch: Party People - Season 2 | Episode 1
node.description: Party People returns with a deep dive into the government's Delta response and Mihingarangi, Tau and Shane dip their toes into the Three Waters reform. Watch the first episode. Video

node.title: Drinking water fluoridation bill passes final reading in Parliament
node.description: The new law will ensure a nationally consistent approach to community water fluoridation based on its well-established benefits, Associate Minister of Health Ayesha Verrall says.

node.title: James Shaw optimistic COP26 negotiations will get results
node.description: The Climate Change Minister is cautiously optimistic two long-stalled climate negotiations might actually get over the line at the COP26 UN summit.

node.title: PM on vaccine mandates: 'Hard to know' how long they will be used
node.description: Mandatory vaccines could be part of New Zealand life for some time to come, with the prime minister reluctant to talk about when they might be lifted.

node.title: Retail reopens in Auckland: Security guards on the doors as shoppers return
node.description: It's day one of alert level 3, step 2 for the city and retailers are flinging open their doors for an expected rush of pent-up demand, while many museums, zoos and libraries are gradually re-opening.

node.title: Pushpay moves into Catholic donations market
node.description: The donor management system software company Pushpay has reported a strong first half net profit driven up by volume and revenue growth.

node.title: Covid-19: Collins supports vaccine mandates, but not forever

node.title: Tītiponamu pair build nest in possum trap
node.description: A pair of tītitipounamu gave conservationists in the Otago Peninsula a shock this week when they found a nest with four very small eggs inside of a possum trap. Audio

node.title: How do vaccinated teachers talk to their anti-vax colleagues?
node.description: As the mandatory deadline approaches, the teaching profession has to wrestle with how to demonstrate the value of manaakitanga to all colleagues, including the unvaccinated, writes Paul Heyward.

node.title: Air NZ should implement no jab, no fly for domestic passengers, health expert says
node.description: Unvaccinated passengers can still travel, if they show a negative test within three days of flying. However, not everyone thinks that's enough to prevent the virus from spreading.

node.title: Unvaccinated teachers 'putting the whole village at risk' - mayor
node.description: It's "crazy" an entire King Country school's staff won't get vaccinated as it puts the whole community at risk, Ruapehu District Mayor Don Cameron says.

node.title: Second man charged with murder over death of Christchurch teen Connor Whitehead
node.description: A 43-year-old man has been charged with murder over Connor Whitehead's death. He's the fifth person to be charged in relation to the shooting, and the second person to face a murder charge.

node.title: Protests against Covid-19 measures, firefighters given vaccine mandate, 125 new cases
node.description: Thousands of protesters turned up at Parliament today, demanding an end to Covid restrictions, while another group blocked Auckland's northern boundary this morning. Meanwhile, 125 new cases were…

node.title: Explainer: Why a judge rejected NZDF claims about exemptions from health and safety laws
node.description: A judge has rejected the New Zealand Defence Force's claim that a training exercise in which a decorated soldier died was exempt from health and safety laws.

node.title: Sound lures stoat to its death on Motutapu Island
node.description: A male stoat has been killed on Motutapu Island after being lured to a trap with a new approach - recordings of baby stoats and female stoat-scented bedding. There has...

node.title: Late vaccination sees elderly woman catch Covid-19 in resthome
node.description: An elderly dementia patient who tested positive for Covid-19 at an Auckland rest home had only received her first dose of the Pfizer vaccine last month at her daughter's request. Audio

node.title: 'We don't get a break': Parents struggle with carer support in lockdown
node.description: Some parents are considering leaving their jobs as they look for a way to support children with additional needs and juggle work commitments during lockdown.

node.title: Covid-19: Mayors frustrated by 'control of information'

node.title: Lake Alice patients frustrated by delays: 'They're wasting our time'
node.description: Former Lake Alice patients have spent decades waiting to see if their pleas for justice over the treatment they received are answered. Now, they are facing even further delays.

node.title: Students crack code revealing kiwi chick will soon hatch

node.title: Crash closes Bay of Plenty road

node.title: Police try to assume people’s online identities
node.description: Police are trying to assume the online identities of suspects and defendants by taking over their social media and email accounts to gather information. Audio

node.title: Hospitals brace for influx of Covid-19 patients
node.description: Hospitals are bracing for an influx of Covid-19 patients before Christmas, but have made major gains in treating them, a hospital boss says. Audio

node.title: Police reject IPCA finding on 'unjustified' search'
node.description: The police watchdog has found officers had no legal right to search a Palmerston North property for a young person, but police disagree with the finding.

node.title: Gisborne cleans up after floods and landslides

node.title: Man accused of murder Chch teen Connor Whitehead remanded in custody
node.description: He will next appear in the High Court on 26 November, along with a 32-year-old man also charged with murder and three others charged with accessory after the fact to murder.

node.title: Deputy dies after she was shot responding to domestic dispute
node.description: The sheriff's office said when deputies arrived, a woman pulled out a gun, fired at the deputies and struck Lena Marshall.

node.title: Storied General Electric to split into 3 public companies

node.title: Robinhood says data breach impacts 7 million customers
node.description: The trading app's shares fell 3.2% in pre-market trading, the company said.

node.title: Family says ex-U.S. Marine on hunger strike in Russian prison

node.title: How climate change threatens pregnant women

node.title: "Time is short" as U.S. races to avert all-out civil war in Ethiopia
node.description: U.S. joins African Union in a last-ditch bid to stop Ethiopia's already catastrophic year-old conflict from spiraling into a much broader war.

node.title: "Tank taxi" offers fun and unique rides — though not the smoothest
node.description: In Norwich, England, Merlin Batchelor got so many requests for rides he made it into a business. The lifts go for about $1,000 each.

node.title: Oscar Pistorius up for parole, but he must meet with victim's parents
node.description: The famous double-amputee athlete was convicted of murder for fatally shooting model Reva Steenkamp in 2013.

node.title: Parole again recommended for Manson follower Leslie Van Houten
node.description: She and other followers fatally stabbed a husband and wife and smeared their blood on the walls.

node.title: 57 million pounds of pandemic-related plastics polluting the ocean
node.description: Researchers said plastic waste generated from hospitals, PPE and packaging material only added to an "already out-of-control problem."

node.title: Tension mounts as soldiers and migrants mass at Belarus-Poland border
node.description: Belarus's Russian-backed leader insists he's "not seeking a fight," but Polish and European leaders accuse him of mounting a "hybrid attack," using innocent migrants as a weapon.

node.title: Accused Capitol rioter seeks political asylum in Belarus
node.description: Evan Neumann was placed on the FBI's Most Wanted List in March.

node.title: Manchester United star receives MBE for his fight against child hunger
node.description: The English soccer star dedicated the award to his mother, who raised him and his siblings as a single mother.

node.title: Climate change conspiracies spreading rapidly during COP26
node.description: Amplified by bots and influencers, millions of posts on social media networks peddle false ideas about climate change.

node.title: Want a Zillow home? Not so fast, flippers.
node.description: Gluts of cheap homes unlikely, considering buying interest from corporate rental giants and longer renovation times.

node.title: Pediatric nurse hasn't considered retirement after 50 years
node.description: The Virginia nurse estimated she has helped care for nearly 50,000 babies — and she doesn't plan to stop.

node.title: Cardona says "no need" for hybrid or remote learning after kids are vaccinated

node.title: GOP congressman gets threats after backing infrastructure bill
node.description: Congressman Fred Upton was among the 13 Republican lawmakers supported the bipartisan infrastructure bill.

node.title: Malala Yousafzai gets married: "A precious day in my life"
node.description: The Pakistani activist said she married partner Asser at a ceremony in Birmingham, England.

node.title: NASA says first Artemis moon landing now expected in 2025
node.description: NASA touts reorganization, resumption of moon lander work as keys to 2025 moon landing.

node.title: Travis Scott and organizers should have stopped Astroworld, fire chief says
node.description: "We all have a responsibility when we attend these venues to ensure each other's safety," the fire chief said.

node.title: Boy "fighting for his life" after he was trampled at Astroworld, lawyers say
node.description: The boy has been placed in a medically induced coma to combat brain, liver and kidney trauma, lawyers said.

node.title: House January 6 committee subpoenas close Trump allies
node.description: The subpoenas show that the committee is delving deeper into the actions of Mr. Trump himself leading up to and on January 6.

node.title: Sununu rejects "debate and talk" of Senate, will run again for governor
node.description: "I'd rather push myself 120 miles an hour delivering wins for New Hampshire than to slow down, end up on Capitol Hill, debating partisan politics without results," Sununu said.

node.title: Drone video shows Rittenhouse fatally shooting man at close range
node.description: Jurors viewed the clearest video yet of the fatal shooting of Joseph Rosenbaum.

node.title: Trump-endorsed Senate candidate denies estranged wife's allegations
node.description: Sean Parnell said he never choked his estranged wife or pinned her down, as she had accused him of doing,

node.title: Justices weigh case of Texas inmate who wants pastor to pray at execution
node.description: Attorneys for John Henry Ramirez argued he is not challenging his conviction, death sentence or method of execution.

node.title: Pfizer asks FDA to authorize booster shot for all adults
node.description: The Pfizer booster is currently recommended for seniors and other higher-risk adults.

node.title: OSHA's vax rule is on hold. Employers urged to still comply.
node.description: Businesses risk being caught unprepared if the regulation survives legal challenges, employment lawyers warn.

node.title: Crowd cheers female hockey goalie targeted by vulgar, sexist chants
node.description: Fans turned out to support a female goalie after students from a rival high school chanted vulgar and sexist slurs at her during a game last week.

node.title: "Squid Game 2" is currently in the works, creator says
node.description: "There will indeed be a second season," Hwang Dong-hyuk told reporters Monday.

node.title: How the infrastructure bill could expand broadband access
node.description: The bill awaiting President Joe Biden's signature includes $65 billion to help close the digital divide.

node.title: Whistleblowers to play key role in enforcing vaccine rule
node.description: OSHA is counting on employees to notify the safety agency if businesses violate the new federal COVID-19 order.

node.title: Aaron Rodgers says he takes "full responsibility" for vaccine comments
node.description: The Green Bay Packers quarterback revealed last week that he has not been vaccinated and has faced heavy criticism for saying in August that he was "immunized."

node.title: Planning your Thanksgiving meal? Better shop early
node.description: Turkey farms report selling out of birds earlier than usual amid increased demand for the key holiday menu item.

node.title: Body of missing University of Alabama student found in river, police say
node.description: Garrett Walker had disappeared early Sunday morning.

node.title: Anonymous app offers support to veterans suffering with mental health
node.description: Some veterans feel there's a stigma around seeking help for mental health. The app seeks to break down those barriers.

node.title: Brian Williams leaving NBC News at the end of the year
node.description: Williams said in a note to colleagues that "following much reflection," he had decided to exit when his contract ends in December.

node.title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
node.description: Recent commercial real estate transactions in New York.

node.title: New Zealand’s Sea Lions Are Back, and Crashing Golf Courses and Soccer Matches
node.description: After their populations were decimated by hunters, New Zealand’s sea lions are returning to the coasts — sometimes surprising locals by turning up in unexpected places.

node.title: In Oaxaca, a Meal to Celebrate a Pioneering Artist’s Legacy
node.description: To fete the opening of a new exhibition of work by — and inspired by — Ana Mendieta, the curator Su Wu gathered friends for a comal-cooked brunch prepared by chef Thalia Barrios Garcia.

node.title: Tiny Love Stories: ‘His Skin Against Mine’
node.description: Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.

node.title: Thandiwe Newton Feeds Her Soul With Critical Race Theory and Cleo Sol
node.description: The “Westworld” actress talks about her new Audible recording of Tolstoy’s “War and Peace” and why too much entertainment can be bad for you.

node.title: Álvarez, Boxing’s Undisputed King, Is a Target for Fighters and Promoters
node.description: Would-be foes and matchmakers see the 168-pound champion as a path to a career payday.

node.title: Marcel Hug and Madison de Rozario Win N.Y.C. Marathon Wheelchair Races
node.description: Hug, a four-time champion, dominated the men’s division, while de Rozario won her first women’s title, pulling away in the second half of the race.

node.title: Playing It Safe, Giants Steal a Win From the Raiders

node.title: Saturday’s Cal-U.S.C. game has been delayed by Covid.
node.description: The matchup is the first game of the season at college football’s top level to be rescheduled because of the virus.

node.title: How hot is lava erupting from Hawaii’s Kilauea volcano?
node.description: Test your science knowledge.

node.title: Should the Democrats Be Less Progressive?
node.description: Readers respond to an editorial that urged the party to be more realistic and moderate. Also: Aaron Rodgers; the anguish of war.

node.title: How Data Is Reshaping Real Estate
node.description: Tech start-ups are offering new tools to help retailers and entertainment venues be more efficient by counting crowds, tracking foot traffic and following local shopping habits.

node.title: The Making of a Feel-Bad Boom
